meanings.definition: A member of the Muslim dynasty of Mongol origin that ruled much of India in the 16th to 19th centuries.
meanings.sent1: The moghuls were known for their grand palaces and intricate artwork.
meanings.sent2: During their reign, the moghuls introduced new architectural styles to India.
meanings.sent3: The moghuls decided to have a race to see who could build the tallest tower in the kingdom.
meanings.sent4: The moghuls' influence in India was as vast as the sky above.
meanings.sent5: The moghuls left a lasting legacy of beauty and culture in India.

meanings.sent1: The local moghul was known for his lavish parties and expensive taste.
meanings.sent2: In the city, the moghuls were often seen driving luxury cars and wearing designer clothes.
meanings.sent3: The moghul decided to buy the entire stock of the rare gemstone to add to his collection.
meanings.sent4: Among the moghuls of the business world, he was considered a titan.
meanings.sent5: Her presence at the event was as commanding as that of a moghul.
